abstracts.cdata!:
The Loan would finance part of the
            foreign exchange cost of impor about 2 million tons of
            fertilizer required by Nigeria for the 1984 an crop years as
            well as the costs of foreign training and communication
            equipment required for the Fertilizer Procurement and
            Distribution Div (FPDD), and studies to assist in the
            development of an appropriate pol framework. The Loan has
            three major objectives: (i) to ensure the ad and timely
            supply of fertilizer to all Bank-assisted ADPs and other
            agricultural areas for the 1984 and 1985 crop years at a
            time of acute exchange constraints; (ii) to assist the
            Federal Government in restruc its fertilizer policy,
            including pricing, subsidization, procurement, marketing, to
            make it an efficient and effective instrument of agricul
            development; and (iii) to ensure additional Federal
            Government support states for funding ongoing Bank-assisted
            ADPs through implementation o development loan stock scheme.
